pullrequest.title: [A-7]Install worlds, and move gui.config to IGN_DATA_INSTALL_DIR

content.raw:
For some reason, the doxygen tags are landing in `/usr/local/share/ignition/ignition-gazebo_1/ignition-gazebo.tag.xml` even though this is version 0, not 1. Should they all be in the same directory?

Also, do we want the worlds to go in a versioned directory? The world files themselves have the `ign-gazebo` version hardcoded in them.
content.html:
For some reason, the doxygen tags are landing in /usr/local/share/ignition/ignition-gazebo_1/ignition-gazebo.tag.xml even though this is version 0, not 1. Should they all be in the same directory?

Also, do we want the worlds to go in a versioned directory? The world files themselves have the ign-gazebo version hardcoded in them.

pullrequest.title: [A-7]Install worlds, and move gui.config to IGN_DATA_INSTALL_DIR

content.raw:
This [cmake PR](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/pull-requests/141) should fix the doxygen tag file install directory. A version 0 will not have a number suffix.

The world files should be installed in a versioned directory, again the version 0 will not appear in the directory name. You can test by changing `project(ignition-gazebo VERSION 0.1.0)` to `project(ignition-gazebo1 VERSION 1.1.0)` in `CMakeLists.txt`.
content.html:
This cmake PR should fix the doxygen tag file install directory. A version 0 will not have a number suffix.

The world files should be installed in a versioned directory, again the version 0 will not appear in the directory name. You can test by changing project(ignition-gazebo VERSION 0.1.0) to project(ignition-gazebo1 VERSION 1.1.0) in CMakeLists.txt.

content.raw: @\_jrivero\_ , any thoughts on this installation pattern?

pullrequest.title: [A-7]Install worlds, and move gui.config to IGN_DATA_INSTALL_DIR

content.raw:
[Debian packaging guidelines](https://www.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/ch-docs.html#examples) says the following:

> Any examples \(configurations, source files, whatever\), should be installed in a directory `/usr/share/doc/package/examples`. These files should not be referenced by any program: they’re there for the benefit of the system administrator and users as documentation only. Architecture-specific example files should be installed in a directory `/usr/lib/package/examples` with symbolic links to them from `/usr/share/doc/package/examples`, or the latter directory itself may be a symbolic link to the former.
>
> If the purpose of a package is to provide examples, then the example files may be installed into `/usr/share/doc/package`.

But this is only in Debian, the [general rules of  FHS](https://refspecs.linuxfoundation.org/FHS_3.0/fhs/index.html) don't say anything about doc or examples. I think it is fine for ign-gazebo to install them somewher under `/usr/share` I can deal with Debian packaging policies if needed.
content.html:
Debian packaging guidelines says the following:

Any examples (configurations, source files, whatever), should be installed in a directory /usr/share/doc/package/examples. These files should not be referenced by any program: they’re there for the benefit of the system administrator and users as documentation only. Architecture-specific example files should be installed in a directory /usr/lib/package/examples with symbolic links to them from /usr/share/doc/package/examples, or the latter directory itself may be a symbolic link to the former.

If the purpose of a package is to provide examples, then the example files may be installed into /usr/share/doc/package.

But this is only in Debian, the general rules of FHS don't say anything about doc or examples. I think it is fine for ign-gazebo to install them somewher under /usr/share I can deal with Debian packaging policies if needed.
